Rec: All anchors require a valid href attribute and link text.  If an image is the sole piece of content inside of the anchor, ensure that the image has descriptive alt text.

If an anchor is opening in a new window, the user must be alerted.  Methods for this include adding 'screen-reader-only' text, or adding an icon with alt text alerting the user.  The most common text for either of these methods is 'Opens in a new window'

All buttons require a valid value and text. Screen readers will read out the text of the button.Example:<button>Submit</button>ARIAYou can also use the attribute 'role="button"' on an anchor and effectively turn it into a button.Example:<a href="javascript:void(0);" role="button">Submit</a>
You shouldn't use a carousel.Example:Should I use a carousel Opens in a new window

Dialogs require a number of considerations.
  1. The parent container (generally a <div> requires the attribute 'role="dialog"'
  2. The parent container (div) should contain the attribute 'aria-lablledby'. The value for this is generally the #id of the <h2> inside of the dialog
  3. The dialog should contain an a heading with a valid #id
    <h2 id="dialog_heading_id"/>
  4. Focus should be trapped inside of the dialog. Tabbing past the last tabbable element should take the user back to the first tabbable element
  5. Ensure all images (background, foreground) have the proper textual equivalent
  6. The background content should have the attribute 'aria-hidden="true"'
Example:For a working example, visit SVA11y.com
Decorative images should have a null alt attribute.Example:<img src='image.png' alt=""/>

If this is a background image and contains text, there must be a textual alternative. Textual alternatives can include visual or 'screen-reader-only' text.Example:<div class='background-img'><span class='screen-reader-only'>TEXTUAL EQUIVALENT</span>
All informational images should contain descriptive alt text.Example:<img src="image.png" alt="Marker is awesome!" />

All form fields require an explicit label. This can be accomplished by either using a <label> element, using the "aria-labelledby" attribute, or using the "aria-label" attribute on the input.Example:<label for="input_id">First name</label>
<input type="text" id="input_id" />OR<input type="text" id="input_id" aria-label="First Name" />
Use native HTML elements (such as input[type=button]) whenever possible. Ensure that there is a valid "value" attribute with a value.Example:<input type="button" value="Submit" />
Input images should be treated the same as an informational image. Ensure the input has explicit alt text. This value cannot be left blank.Example:<input type="image" alt="Submit" />
Ensure that the <html> element has a valid 'lang' attribute.
This should be marked up as a heading level 1 (<h1>).Example:<h1>Marker!</h1>
This should be marked up as a heading level 2. (<h2>).Example:<h2>Who should use Marker?</h2>
This should be marked up as a heading level 3 (<h3>).Example:<h3>Headings must follow semantic order</h2>
This should be marked up as a heading level 4 (<h4>).Example:<h4>Ensure there is a heading level 3</h4>
This should be marked up as a heading level 5 (<h5>).Example:<h5>Do you have a heading level 4?</h5>
This should be marked up as a heading level 6 (<h6>).Example:<h6>Don't use this because of it's size</h6>

Menus require the following aria attributes:
  • Role="menu" on the <UL>
  • Role="menuitem" on each sub-item <LI>
WCAG ExampleARIA Menus

Ensure that all form fields have an explicit label with a valid 'for' attribute that associates the label to the select boxExample: <label for="select_box_id">Select</label>
<select id="select_box_id"></select>

Tabsets require the following aria attributes:
  • Role=&auot;tabset" on the <ul>
  • Role="tab"
Ensure that this page has a descriptive title.  Screen readers read out the title of the page before anything else, so this is very important.

Tabular data should be marked up in a data table, with a caption and table headings.  The caption for the table doesn't necessarily have to be a caption element, but can be also be a heading that is associated to the table with the 'aria-labelledby' attribute.  Table headings that are positioned in the row should use the attribute 'scope=row'.
Tables used for layout purposes should always have the attribute 'role="presentation"'.Example:<table role="presentation" />
